Ice::

She watched the screen with high interest. She was never very good 
with these things, but still wanted to learn about them. She saw how 
the DNA was structured and how it interlinked.
"Do you think that if the viru is still present inside of me that I 
can still, ah, change?"
She wasn't to sure on how the answer may come out, but she was very 
curious about it.

She heard his comment on Lunarpine and her spark fell slightly. "Yes, 
I suppose your right. But I still have great feeling for him." She 
breathed a heavy sigh and walked over to her corner.

She layed down and wondered what would happen to her and Lunarpine.
She was thinking about how he said he would help her, but how could 
he?  It was her problem to get her new form under control, not his.

She stood up and tried to transform into the griffen mode. But she 
got stuck. her wings didn't come out fully and her owl head was 
jamming half way out. "ARRHHGG!" she groaned.  She stopped and tried 
again, but she couldn't transform fully. She strained and make the 
internal gears grind. It gave out a loud grinding sound as she 
finally finished the transformation. But she wasn't a griffin. She 
stood upright on two legs, covered with soft, white fur. Her head was 
her robotic head. Her hands were still like her polar bear paws, but 
her fingers were more defined.  Her light gray owl wings were on her 
shoulder blades.  She looked at herself and smiled. "This is a form 
that I think I like."  Her female figure was more defined with this 
mode, even though her body was covered with soft, white fur.
She felt like her body had finally settled down. The tingling feeling 
had stopped and her internal proccesses had ceased to change.

She smiled."I'll stay here in the lab untill you tell me to. And I'm 
sorry for running away earlier. I know that it was stupid of me to do 
that. From now on, I'll follow your orders. Also, can you do one more 
scan? I want to make sure that I won't change any more." She 
chuckled, "If I keep changing, I'll start to have an identity 
crisis." she couldn't help but laugh a little. It had been a while, a 
long while since she had laughed.
